result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) Burnett County Case #14CF22 [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25), Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) Burnett County Case #14CF22 [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25), Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jon G Isker Jr was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jon G Isker Jr was found guilty of OWI (6th) Burnett County Case #14CF22 [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25), Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Counts to run concurrent (St. Croix County and Burnett County consolidated).
Court dismisses Counts 2, 4 and 5.
Probation to commence July 6, 2015.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: to Count 3

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Jon G Isker appeared from jail.  Court called at 9:42 a.m.  Set for Plea/Sentencing.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form the Court in 15CF80 & 14CF22.  Attorney Andrea makes statement.  Consolidating SCC Case 15CF80 & Burnett County Case 14CF22.  S/T of Jon G. Isker.  Direct by Attorney Andrea.  Mr. Isker stipulates to the fact the SCC Case 15CF80 constitutes an OWI 5th and the Burnett County Case 14CF22 constitues an OWI 6th.  Cross by ADA Nieskes.   Witness excused.  State will file an amended Information in 15CF80.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 1 in 15CF80.  Guilty plea is entered.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF80.  On Motion of the State, Crt dismisses all other counts in 15CF80.  Court adjourned at 10:00.  Case called for Burnett County Case 14CF22.  Court finds the consolidation 15CF80 & 14CF22 was done properly.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 in 14CF22.  Guilty plea is entered.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2 in 14CF22. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses all other counts in 14CF22. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement.  Crt orders:  

Ct. 1 in 15CF80 to run concurrent with Ct. 2 in 14CF22
W/S with 3 years probation and conditions
- Conditions of probation:
- DE sentenced to 1 year in the St. Croix County Jail
- DE can serve sentence in Eau Claire County at no charge to St. Croix County 
- 130 days credit for time served in St. Croix County Jail (not concurrent)
- 2 days credit for time served in Burnett County will (not concurrent)
- AODA with follow through and any recommended treatment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- 36 months driver license revocation
- 36 months IID
- Restitution of $2,869.68 to be paid first to A. Radunz and B. Betz before applying money to fines
- Restitution of $52.00 to be paid to the St. Croix County Sheriff's Department for a blood draw
- Court costs of $1424.00 on 15CF80 (not concurrent)
- Court costs of $1424.00 on 14CF22 (not concurrent)
- Court orders one DNA surcharge of $250.00
- Probation to begin today on 07/06/2015
- 20 days to appeal

Set for internal review.  Review scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 07:55 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Jennifer Anne Bork, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Jon G Isker appeared from jail.  Court called at 3:10 p.m.  Attorney Andrea advises the court the DE has reviewed the Information.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on all counts.  Court reviews letter from treatment center.  Bail modification is denied at this time.  Set out for a STC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 3:18 p.m. lw  Status conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Arraignment on March 23, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Jon G Isker appeared from jail.  Court called at 11:36 a.m.  Set for an arraignment.  DE has not reviewed the Information so will continue the arraignment.  Attorney Andrea is advising the court the family is working on getting the DE into treatment.  DE needs to be in person for the assessment at the treatment facility.  Attorney Andrea is asking to modify the bond and release the DE to be taken by the family for an assessment and if they have a bed available he would be admitted today.  If DE is not admitted to inpatient treatment the DE would be brought back to the St. Croix County Jail.  Attorney Nieskes makes objection and arguments.  Court is asking for something in writing from the treatment facility confirming the process for admitting the DE to inpatient treatment.   Bail is continued.  Continue the arraignment.  Court adjourned at 11:48 a.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kevin Gehler, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Jon G Isker appeared from jail.  Court called at 9:14 a.m.  S/T of Deputy Thomas Williams of the St. Croix County Sheriff's Office.  Direct by ADA Gehler.  DE is identified by Deputy Williams.  State - Ex. 1 (Record of DE's Prior Convictions) O/R.  State - Ex. 2 (Bail Bond for 14CF22) O/R.  State asks the court to take Judicial Notice of 14CF22.  Court takes Judicial Notice of 14CF22.  Cross by Attorney Andrea.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and that the DE probably committed it and binds the DE over for trial.  Attorney Andrea argues bond.  Court continues the bond.  Set out for arraignment.  Court adjourned at 9:39 a.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 11:30 am.
